xierpa3.toolbox.storage.status package¶

Submodules¶

xierpa3.toolbox.storage.status.status module¶

class xierpa3.toolbox.storage.status.status.Status(**args)¶

Bases: object

The <code>Status</code> class offers a “lazy” storage of basic values, that can be stored with JSON in the <code>StatusField</code> field of a database record. It can contain an arbitrary set of attributes and getting an attribute that does not exist, simply answers <code>None</code>, so in general they don’t need to be initialized if the default value is <code>False</code>.<br/> Note that this is an easy, simple, flat storage device. If storage in a tree is required, then use <code>Node<code>, <code>Tree</code> or <code>State</code> classes.

isAllowedValueType(value)¶
class xierpa3.toolbox.storage.status.status.XXXData(**args)¶

Bases: xierpa3.toolbox.storage.status.status.Status

Data is identical to Status, except that it allows non-isAllowedValueType values as storage. (Which makes the instances more flexible, but they cannot be stored automatically as JSON or plist).
